definition.name: Rust Cache
definition.description: A GitHub Action that implements smart caching for rust/cargo projects with sensible defaults.
definition.author: Arpad Borsos <swatinem@swatinem.de>

inputs.name: prefix-key
inputs.description: The prefix cache key, this can be changed to start a new cache manually.

inputs.name: shared-key
inputs.description: A cache key that is used instead of the automatic `job`-based key, and is stable over multiple jobs.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: An additional cache key that is added alongside the automatic `job`-based cache key and can be used to further differentiate jobs.

inputs.name: env-vars
inputs.description: Additional environment variables to include in the cache key, separated by spaces.

inputs.name: workspaces
inputs.description: Paths to multiple Cargo workspaces and their target directories, separated by newlines.

inputs.name: cache-directories
inputs.description: Additional non workspace directories to be cached, separated by newlines.

inputs.name: cache-targets
inputs.description: Determines whether workspace targets are cached. If `false`, only the cargo registry will be cached.

inputs.name: cache-on-failure
inputs.description: Cache even if the build fails. Defaults to false.

inputs.name: cache-all-crates
inputs.description: Determines which crates are cached. If `true` all crates will be cached, otherwise only dependent crates will be cached.

inputs.name: save-if
inputs.description: Determiners whether the cache should be saved. If `false`, the cache is only restored.

inputs.name: cache-provider
inputs.description: Determines which provider to use for caching. Options are github or buildjet, defaults to github.

inputs.name: lookup-only
inputs.description: Check if a cache entry exists without downloading the cache

outputs.name: cache-hit
outputs.description: A boolean value that indicates an exact match was found.

evidence.reasoning: The Rust Cache action is designed to implement smart caching for Rust/Cargo projects, which directly relates to managing dependencies efficiently by reducing build times.
